cheatsheet.title: Creating and deploying application to OpenShift

intro.description: This cheatsheet will guide you through creating, building and deploying application to Openshift.

item.title: Start CDK/Minishift
item.description: Follow these steps to start CDK/Minishift in Eclipse

subitem.label: On local tool bar press 'Start the server' button
Wait for virtual machine is up and running
Accept untrusted SSL certificate to connect to OpenShift cluster

item.title: Create OpenShift Application
item.description: Follow these steps to create, build, and deploy the application

subitem.label: Select 'New->Application...' from context menu for root node
Select nodejs-mongo-persistent project from 'Server application source' list
Press 'Next' button to see 'Template parameters' page
Press 'OK' button in 'Create Application Summary' dialog
Press 'OK' button in 'Create Application Summary' dialog
Press 'Finish' button in 'Import OpenShift Application' dialog
Press 'Yes' button to create server adapter for imported application

item.title: Wait Application built and deployed
item.description: When the application is finished building and deploying you should see two running pods in OpenShift Explorer View.

item.title: Open Application home page in browser
item.description: At this point, you've successfully built and deployed a Node.js and MongoDB application in containers running on OpenShift on your personal OpenShift cluster. From context menu for 'My Project' node in OpenShift Explorer tree select 'Show In->Web Browser' to see your Application home page in browser.
